page.title: 17LEISURE AND RECREATION
page.content: Pudsey is well served with leisure activities.In Pudsey Park,which was opened in 1889,there is lovely scenery and a play-ground with swings, slides and a steamroller for children to clamber over.New additions are in the development stage. Pudsey has no cinema now,but once it had three.While there is no professional theatre there is a wide variety of amateur productions.Pudsey has its own arts festival,too - The Simeon Gaunt Memorial Festival.Pudsey Civic Hall is the venue for dances, concerts,discos and receptions.There are numerous youth clubs in the area. Youth is also catered for by Scouts, Guides,Boys' Brigade and Air Training Corps - all with many branches. A new community centre is nearing completion on the Swinnow estate on Swinnow Lane.
